provenance.textSnippet: Mean resting corrected QT interval (QTc) >470 msec, obtained from 3 ECGs, using the screening clinic ECG machine-derived QTcF value.
provenance.rationale: QTc is an explicit parameter used in the eligibility criteria for the study, indicating it is a required measurement from the ECG.

provenance.textSnippet: Patients with QTcF prolongation to >500 msec should have study treatment interrupted and regular ECGs performed until resolution to <481 msec
provenance.rationale: QTcF is explicitly mentioned as the key parameter for dose modification decisions, indicating it is a required measurement from the ECG.

expansions.rationale: Found 2 explicit ECG parameters (QTc, QTcF) defined in the eligibility criteria and dose modification rules within the extraction JSON. The protocol emphasizes cardiac safety monitoring via these specific measurements.

provenance.textSnippet: A pre-surgical MRI or contrast CT scan of the brain is considered standard of care and must be done prior to surgery.
provenance.rationale: The protocol explicitly lists MRI of the brain as one of the two acceptable imaging procedures for this assessment.

provenance.textSnippet: The imaging modalities used for radiological assessments will be CT scans of the chest and abdomen (including liver and adrenal glands) with contrast.
